title.narrative: 4.2: ADVOCACY, ENGAGEMENT AND COMMUNITYPARTICIPATION FOR CHILD RIGHT

description.narrative: Communities in priority regions, including CSOs, women and youth advocate for child rights and participate in the planning, budgeting and monitoring of the delivery of social services for children to enhance national and local accountability and ownership. , which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys live in more-inclusive and resilient communities strengthened by an enabling environment and systems that createequitable chances in life.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
Policy dialogue and advocacy on decentralization coordination and implementation
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action
